intro: Vanda tesselloides, commonly known as the tessellated vanda, is an epiphytic orchid native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and clusters of fragrant, showy flowers. The plant typically produces pendulous inflorescences with flowers in shades of white, yellow, and orange. Vanda tesselloides thrives in humid, tropical environments and requires bright, indirect light for optimal growth. Its unique appearance and long blooming period make it a popular choice among orchid enthusiasts.
